page.title: 17The Gospel Hall,Helions.
page.content: This is a small chapel for worship situated between Helions Bumpstead Village centre and Pale Green. It is run by the{Plymouth Brethren.}The Gospel Hall is 100 years old. It is called the Gospel Hall because they teach people about gospels. They used to have Sunday School but they found so many people went out on Sundays that they replaced it by{Treasure {seekers}on Thursdays.John Frost thought of the name Treasure seekers. It is run by the{Ramseys}and some of the{Cornells.}The Cornell family have now gone to Brazil to teach people about God. At Treasure seekers they have songs, quizzes, bible stories. They give stickers out every week, and every so often we have a swap shop when we can exchange our stickers for little presents.Every year we have a trip to the seaside.
